intro: Fockea edulis var. capensis, commonly known as the Cape fockea, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, fragrant, white or pink flowers that bloom in summer. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it drought-tolerant. The plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
